info.title: Perishable Product Service
info.description:
A RESTful API for tracking a grocery store's inventory of
perishable goods developed with Java and Spring.

externalDocs.description: Spring Boot Actuator Web API Documentation

post.description:
Get all products matching given ``quality`` and calculate values & dates based on days to offset (``dayOffset``) & ``qualityOperation``. #### DataView:
  • Where applicable, sort args apply to both parent product objects and nested stock items.
  • Limit applies to the total nested stock items across all product objects.
  • If dataView or any of its properties are omitted, defaults are generated programmatically.
#### Quality Operations:
  • 0: Quality decrements daily by 1. Once the sellByDate has passed, quality degrades twice as fast.
  • 1: Quality increments daily by 1 and continues incrementing by 1 after the sellByDate has passed.
  • 2: Quality increments daily by 1. When 10 or fewer days remain until the sellByDate, quality increments daily by 2. After the sellByDate has passed, quality drops to 0.
  • 3: Quality never decrements.
An item's quality may never fall below 0. An item's sellBy decrements daily by 1.

Quality Response 1.description:
Retrieves all products with the given ``quality`` and off sets the current date by 5 days.


Note that the ``futureDate`` property represents the adjusted date for calculations
and that ``quality`` & ``sellBy`` have decremented by 5.


The days between ``stockDate`` and ``futureDate`` are used when computing these values.

Quality Response 2.description:
Retrieves all products with the given ``quality`` and does *not* off set the current date.


Note that there is *no* ``futureDate`` property
and that ``quality`` & ``sellBy`` have *not* decremented.


The days between ``stockDate`` and ``currentDate`` are used when computing these values.

post.description: Get product matching given ``uuid`` and calculate values & dates based on days to offset (``dayOffset``) & ``qualityOperation``.

Id Response 1.description:
Retrieves product with the given ``uuid`` and off sets the current date by 5 days.


Note that the ``futureDate`` property represents the adjusted date for calculations
and that ``quality`` & ``sellBy`` have decremented by 5.


The days between ``stockDate`` and ``futureDate`` are used when computing these values.

Id Response 2.description:
Retrieves product with the given ``uuid`` and does *not* off set the current date.


Note that there is *no* ``futureDate`` property
and that ``quality`` & ``sellBy`` have *not* decremented.


The days between ``stockDate`` and ``currentDate`` are used when computing these values.

post.description: Create new products in the inventory

Creation Request 1.description: ``quality`` is specified for each new inventory item separately

Creation Request 2.description: ``quality`` is specified for all new inventory items with same value

post.description:
Get all products in the inventory and calculate values & dates based on days to offset (``dayOffset``) & ``qualityOperation``. #### DataView:
  • Where applicable, sort args apply to both parent product objects and nested stock items.
  • Limit applies to the total nested stock items across all product objects.
  • If dataView or any of its properties are omitted, defaults are generated programmatically.
#### Quality Operations:
  • 0: Quality decrements daily by 1. Once the sellByDate has passed, quality degrades twice as fast.
  • 1: Quality increments daily by 1 and continues incrementing by 1 after the sellByDate has passed.
  • 2: Quality increments daily by 1. When 10 or fewer days remain until the sellByDate, quality increments daily by 2. After the sellByDate has passed, quality drops to 0.
  • 3: Quality never decrements.
An item's quality may never fall below 0. An item's sellBy decrements daily by 1.

All Products Response 1.description:
Retrieves all products and off sets the current date by 5 days.


Note that the ``futureDate`` property represents the adjusted date for calculations
and that ``quality`` & ``sellBy`` values for each inventory item have updated
in accordance with ``qualityOperation`` values.

All Products Response 2.description:
Retrieves all products and does *not* off set the current date.


Note that there is *no* ``futureDate`` property
and that ``quality`` & ``sellBy`` values for each inventory item have *not* updated.


The days between ``stockDate`` and ``currentDate`` are used when computing these values.

All Products Response 3.description:
Retrieves all products and uses default ``dataView`` object.


Note that there is *no* ``futureDate`` property
and that ``quality`` & ``sellBy`` values for each inventory item have *not* updated.


The days between ``stockDate`` and ``currentDate`` are used when computing these values.

get.summary: Get Redis key-value pair by key

404.description: No products found with any provided ``uuids``
